Reviews.Title: “Saving Grace. 'Quadeer the night receptionist' our angel!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam for 2 nights in the Flying Pig Downtown. Unfortunately we missed our flight and had to return to Amsterdam to stay one more night and somehow rebook our flights..with very little budget or time at 11.30 pm and raining outside..we stopped at The Dam Hotel, due to the location being situated right next to Central Station. We were greeted by the night Receptionist Quadeer - what a gentleman..not only did we manage to secure a room at a great rate, we were also allowed access to the internet, a pc and a printer to rebook our flights and print out our boarding pass. We weren't expecting much but we were pleasantly surprised when we reached the rooms. it was big spacious and immaculately clean - unfortunately we were only looking for a quick nap and away again the next day it would have been great to stay longer..but for the price and the hospitality we received I will most definitely return. It is a pity there are not more people in the world like the hotel staff Quadeer he really helped us and although it was late at night he was not annoyed by us and the requests to use his personal facilities, he was very friendly, told me to relax, take a seat and it would be okay. I honestly don't know what we would have done without him. 100% 10/10 satisfied

Reviews.Title: “dont go”
Reviews.Author: Robert E Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room was horrible, bugs in bed and stank of damp couldnt offer us another room so we moved hotel

Reviews.Title: “Central and cheap, but an unpleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kernowkerensa
Reviews.Content: Chose this "hotel" as it seemed the most central of the many Amsterdam hostels pretending to be a hotel when you search online. It's not a hotel in any way, shape or form. On the plus side, it was very central and Amsterdam itself is stunningly beautiful. Reviewers moaning about the steep stairs and the fact that some of the staff didn't speak English, should maybe go and stay in an English-speaking country. There was a working colour TV with several channels on in my room (203). Negatives: Room was not very clean - toothpaste and other stains on sink and decor in general was unkempt. My window was in fact actually a glass pane leading on to a housekeeping cupboard, so I could not look outside or air my room at all. The housekeeping cupboard must have led to a skylight as natural light came in, but also a lot of draught, which made the room cold at times. There was no heater to warm the room/dry your things on when it rained. Despite the signs warning guests that they would be fined for smoking in the rooms, I could smell normal cigarettes and cannabis being smoked regularly from other rooms in the corridor, along with loud music and drunken yelling. This made it difficult to sleep, especially as the housekeeping cupboard that adjoined my room was only locked with a small cheap padlock and I was constantly afraid of someone breaking in as a drunken prank. I would definitely not recommend this hotel for female solo travellers and made sure I noted down the names of as many decent looking hotels as possible while I was there so I never have to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “DAM [--] HOTEL. PLEASE READ”
Reviews.Author: katie r
Reviews.Content: To start off our horrible experience with the Dam Hotel...they put us in a separate hotel called the orange tulip, it had steep curved staircase and when we asked the reception man to help us with our bags he said no. we got put into room 107, it was small and the tv didn't work and there was no wi-fi. We called into our room the next day and there was a random Chinese guy just stood there and didn't speak a word of English. The room was so cold we had no sleep, it felt like there window was wide open. Also there seemed to be someone doing DIY in the middle of the night because all we could here was a constant banging. We spent one night in there and by the next day we asked to changed rooms. We changed to room 305 in another building, it was warmer than the first room but as soon as we opened the bathroom we were nearly sick with the disgusting stench coming from the vent in the ceiling. it smelt like there was a dead pigeon stuck in the roof or something. when you turned the light on the vent started going automatically so you could always smell this weird smell. we walked into our room one afternoon, the tv was on, the window was wide open and they hadn't even changed our bed sheet. DO NOT STAY HERE IT IS [--] DISGUSTING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER! AND I NEVER WRITE REVIEWS, but its so bad I HAVE TO”
Reviews.Author: thanhh__hx
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend basically booked to go amsterdam last minute for a one day business trip, we didn't want to spend a lot of money so we picked the cheapest, alright looking one. When we got there, we booked for Budget Dam Hotel, but the name had changed to a different name. Its in a good location but the hotel is disgusting, it has a foul stench throughout the hotel and the rooms were small and dirty. We obviously knew we was going to get something cheap, but what happened over night was disgusting. We both slept, and while sleeping, i woke up twice and saw TWO different BUGS walking around the bed, we swept it off and thought nothing of it, until i woke up with an ITCHY RASH on my neck. It itched so badly, we left the hotel, and during the day, the rash got worst and it spread all over my arms and my body. I had an allergic reaction to all the BED BUG BITES from that hotel, I couldn't go to work and the itching was so bad its unbearable. Still itching now, and its been a week, a few days after we came back, the bites and rashes started to come up on my boyfriends body, incredibly itchy and irritating and disgusting. We wanted a cheap hotel, and we can deal with untidy and dirty, BUT BUGS biting you while you sleep is unacceptable. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!! THE PRICE IS NOT WORTH THE BUGS AND THE BITES! I'VE READ OTHER REVIEWS AND PEOPLE HAVE HAD THE SAME PROBLEM! I'VE NEVER WRITTEN A REVIEW ABOUT ANYWHERE BEFORE I HAVE ABOUT THIS HOTEL JUST BECAUSE ITS SO DISGUSTING AND I WOULDNT WISH THE ITCHY BITES AND RASHES ON ANYONE ELSE. ME AND MY BOYFRIEND STILL HAVE THE RASHES AFTER A WEEK! SO PICK ANOTHER HOTEL, ANYYYYYY HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Total dump”
Reviews.Author: D1sc0_70
Reviews.Content: It doesn't matter how much everywhere else costs in Amsterdam compared to this place, DO NOT STAY HERE! It's really disgusting - I mean, really dreadful. Try and sum up an image of the worst hotel you can - filthy stairs above a cheap pizza shop leading to a dodgy man behind a perspex screen unable to find your reservation. Tiny, dirty public areas and don't even think about entering the rooms. Even the [---] students looked unhappy to be there. Gross, should have it's license revoked.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even consider it !”
Reviews.Author: Marc M
Reviews.Content: Cheap by Amsterdam standards, and centrally located near the Station but that's it ! Appalling hotel (and I use that word loosely) which would be be out of place in replacing Guantanamo Bay as an internment centre. Arrived late in the evening, so was a case of take it, or sleep in the Central Station.... .mmmm looking back I think the latter opinion might have been better. The room was so small that one person had to actually lie on the bed in order for the other to squeeze past. The bathroom stinked, and in the morning, after throwing back the duvet, we found 2 black weevil-like bugs in the bed. We didn't bother looking for more.... just packed up & left.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely trip”
Reviews.Author: Ken L
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed 3 nights in the Dam hotel. We got a double bed room after checked in. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. The room was cleaned daily and the housekeeper man was very helpful. The location of Dam hotel is perfect. It is nearby every city sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Have fun sleeping with mice in your room”
Reviews.Author: parkkepper08
Reviews.Content: I will start this review with the one positive aspect of Dam Hotel its location. Dam Hotel is locaated in the very center of all the action in Amsterdam and made doing things very simple but that is where I draw the line. Dam hotel is the worst hotel of all time. First of all it is nearly impossible to find because you must go up a set of stairs to the front desk and the sign outside the door in not the name of the hotel, or at least the name has been changed and not been updated on the internet. To get to our room we had to climb Mt. Everest. The stairways are basically like climbing a ladder they are so steep and narrow. Our room was on the third floor and when we opened our door to room 308 what did we find, another set of stairs. In our four bed room we had a set of mattresses that were nearly impossible to sleep on they were so stiff. In addition to the bed we were not given ample sheets and covers. The beds come with an elastic sheet to cover the mattress and one comforter. NO SHEETS! the room was either freezing cold or unbearably hot as we tried to sleep. This is where things get fun...good luck trying to sleep because there will more than likely be mice crawling all around the room while you sleep digging through your trash and food. We were tortured by mice every night we were there and got a severe lack of sleep. We discovered a giant mouse hole in the wall behind the radiator. I was woken up several times by the sounds of mice scratching around in the walls. The room did have a TV but with 3 channels that work for maybe 1/3 of the time when they are covered in static and squeaking sounds. My guess is the the cable wires have been chewed to shreds by mice in the walls. Then came the bathroom situation. There is one toilet and one shower for the whole floor. The shower is a glorified closet with water shooting out and smells of feet and mildew. The toilet is nearly unusable because of the overwhelming stench of urine and puke that the floor is covered in. With the mice, the never ending ladder of a staircase, and the awful smells and cleanliness of the entire place, I'd have to say this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and if i wasn't very tired and exhausted from a long weekend at the coffee shops I could not have done it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but not much else”
Reviews.Author: Steven2482
Reviews.Content: Good location, The hotels was very run down, our two rooms were clean but very tired the shower rooms when we came back at the end of the day stunk all in all not good but pretty cheap for amterdam,

Reviews.Title: “If you have another choice perhaps you should choose that one instead!”
Reviews.Author: ank221060
Reviews.Content: This is a backpacker hotel and that is both being kind to the hotel and not very respectful about backpackers who probably do not really have to stoop so low! This is a noisy, dirty, unmaintained fleatrap of a place and a potential deathtrap. I felt that if there was a fire there is no escape except down the one single steep staircase...and that takes you past the chip shop with deep fat fryers on the ground floor which is probably where a fire would have started..... The place, three months after the visit, is making me itch just thinking about it... If, like it was to me, this is presented as the last place to stay on a short notice trip to Amsterdam it's easy...do'nt go to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “the worst place iÂ´ve ever stayed in my life”
Reviews.Author: lfrcruz
Reviews.Content: When I want to Europe and looked for hotels on the internet, Dam hotel looked like one of the best ones I found in amsterdam. When i got there it was the worst experience ive ever had in europe. The stairs were realy tight, the recepcionist looked like one of the worst looking girls from the red light district and the rooms were disgusting. The shower always flooded, the beds were filthy, it was noisy all the time, the internet didnt work, it smeeled terrible, and i was afraid to leave my belonging in the hotel. The staff was rude and didnÂ´t help me at all. I tried to get my money back, but they didnÂ´t give me, and said that it was hotel policies. DonÂ´t stay there, itÂ´s the worst thing you can do in such a beautifull city!

Reviews.Title: “Basically a place to sleep and thats all”
Reviews.Author: Shuriken32
Reviews.Content: Was cheap and could accomodate 6 friends in the one room, the room size was long but TINY and had 6 beds in it, very small area, like an orphanage? Had a sink in the room but you had to go downstairs and use the communal toilet/ shower area, was very uncomfortable, I didnt use the shower there because I didnt want to touch the shower curtain in the communal toilet/shower. Like most places in Amsterdam stairs were insanely steep, difficult to tackle when you are drunk etc. Apart from the hostel being a place I wouldnt put a pet, actually had a great time, if you go in a group and plan on having an amazing time then the hostel probably wont bother you!!

Reviews.Title: “Dam Hotel - Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: MarkWButler5705
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel a while ago, forgot to review it at the time, because it was fairly poor. The rooms were small and dirty, the TV was on a stand and didn't work. However the staff, who were mainly Chinese at the time were really friendly. Only stayed for two days, but wouldn't go again, not the worst, but far from the best, great central location though. Mark

Reviews.Title: “everything good good!”
Reviews.Author: Eric3132
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly, helpful and flexible.The hotel location is very convenient to go everywhere. They offer disscount card for museum pass and restaurant . my friend travel with me, when we check in the staff said the bathroom of room was our of order, the staff were very nice upgrade my room to private room and keep same rate. thank you for them!

Reviews.Title: “friendly dam hotel”
Reviews.Author: sabrina3132
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable bed and great shower. Good price with breakfast disscount card,special Staff, I might miss the name of her, her name is Allie, she is very nice and helpful staff at the reception desk. I forgot my visa-card after I paid the room fee, she kept my visa-card safety. I can trust that she's very honest person in this hotel. Hope to see her again as a Manager there. Please do not forget our Lojanavancih Family. Miss you.

Reviews.Title: “The location is really good”
Reviews.Author: shirley071
Reviews.Content: + Location was very good, right in the red light district and two streets behind Dam square. We (2 girls, 1 guy) felt safe during day and night. + 3 private bedroom on the upper level of the hotel. We had our own beds and own bathroom with shower, sink and toilet. Very nice and clean. Mind the steeps steps before getting to the upper level. We managed it, even with our heavy luggage. Totally worth it. - no breakfast at the moment we were there,

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location, Not Prime Property”
Reviews.Author: kellbert
Reviews.Content: I found this property on the internet and the price suggested a good value at 100 euros ($130) per night. I saw good reviews (7/10) and it claimed to be 2 stars. I was looking for a room near to the Amsterdam Central Station. It was 5 minutes walk and when we found the entrance, I knew I was in for surprise. Having written several reviews, this is the first one for a property I cannot recommend. The "lobby" is on the second floor, up a very narrow staircase. The gentleman was pleasant and explained that the hotel was in two buildings. My room was back down the stairs across the restaurant next door and up a similar set of stairs. I have seen bigger closets. The double room consisted of a bed and a very narrow walkway to the entrance. There was a useless wardrobe at the end of the bed and no place to put our one piece of luggage. We put it on the floor to open it and found we could not open the bathroom door or exit the room. The TV did not work and there was no telephone. There was a door that opened onto the street from which we had marvelous views of Damrak Street and the filthy roof of the restaurant. This was the bright spot in the stay. The bath was barely acceptable with no bath mata and only two worn towels. On the plus side there was plenty of hot water and the bath and room were fairly clean. We found the maid service to be adequate. The strength of the internet signal was poor but it actually worked. The lobby has no printer. If you need to print something, there is a internet cafe about 6 blocks away. [Some of the room are dormoritory style wth 7 beds for 15 Euros per night each.] To give this hotel one star is a bit of a stretch. I did feel safe as there was a 24 hour person at the desk and the entrance lock was controlled that person. The door to our suite had an electronic lock and was secure. We did sleep well on both nights. They did hold our bags after check-out which was helpful. I would have been happier paying more if I knew the very basic nature of this hotel. If you can live with the above, the location (if arriving by train) is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Case Place”
Reviews.Author: GZahl
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell: I saw many hotels, but this was the worst experience in Europe. I stayed in this hotel for five nights during a trade show, and the only reason why we did not move out immediately was that Amsterdam's hotels were all overbooked. So we arranged with awful, tiny, filthy rooms with a musty smell, defective electrical appliances, a complete lack of service, unfriendly chinese staff that spoke neither english nor french nor german but just a few words dutch and a lot of noise. When we departed each of us had a struggle with the receptionist about extra costs that they tried to charge.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: TheHague070
Reviews.Content: I have no good word for this hotel, and this in the capital of our country? The hotel was very disgusting, do they never clean the hotel or something? Also the staff of the hotel we didn't trust. I have no good word for this hotel, also the location is not good if you ask me, the whole Damrak is a mess. Next time i will go to a Van der Valk or other reliable hotel(Hilton, Marriott etc), because this was a big mistake of me to stay at the damhotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really really bad...”
Reviews.Author: LondonWestLondon
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the hotel is the location. The rest is awful. I pre-booked trough a website and when I arrived at the hotel the very unfriendly and unpleasant staff wanted to charge me 5% more because I was paying by card (and not cash) also in order to get the key the receptionist asked me for â‚¬10. The room was dirty (you wouldn't walk bare foot on the carpet), smelly and dark. The hotel is also full of mice, saw two in the room.... but could hear a lot more... Very noisy place, could not sleep at all. Luckily stayed there for one night only!! Would NEVER EVER stay there again.....

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay In This Hotel - It is Not Safe!”
Reviews.Author: edwardostaffs
Reviews.Content: i have just come back from the dam hotel with 7 friends. On our last night we had someone break into our room whilst we were fast asleep in the room. The guy stole a number of items from us and escaped via the fire escape. After looking at the cctv in the morning at reception (after a heated conversation with the receptionist because she would not let us view it) the guy actually entered from the outside of the fire escape. The hotel were less then helpful and said nothing could be done so basically go away!!! This totally spoilt our stay in Amsterdam and would not advise anyone to stay there. Anyone could walk in off the streets into the hotel. i advise you to pay a little more and stay somewhere that actually acre about there customers! Apart from that we had a big mop in the shower, so once we turned the shower off we had to mop away all the water because it did not go down the plug. The light and plug sockets were also hanging off the wall showing bare electrical wires!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: nzgirlontour
Reviews.Content: Positives: Located on Damrak, it is just opposite the station, and within easy walking distance to everything you need (food, dance, drink, fun). Was clean, and towels were replaced in the morning. Room was ready earlier than expected. Nice shower. Negatives: Very expensive for what you get. Room was very tiny, only just fit in two single beds with about 10cm room in between. Getting to the room was a mission. You had to climb two flights of stairs, then go down a corridor, then take an elevator to get to your room. When you've had a long day sightseeing or a big night out its really quite tiring. Overall: I would say this is a great hotel to stay in if it cost half the price!!!!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: jamaicaadam
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night stay with my husband and friends in the dam hotel we paid 147euros for a double room which was situated in what I could only describe as a cellar we turned on the light which was an inch thick of dust carpets filthy and black hairs all over the bed.We immediately went to reception and asked for a room change which they gave us a room up four flights of stairs it was better situated it compromised of a single bed and a set of bunk beds the wall lights were just hanging wires exposed filthy carpets Ihad to use a towel to walk on I slept on bottom bunk and when I looked up the mattress above me had been set a light toe nails pubic hairs and debris down side of bed the bathroom wasnt too bad black mould on shower curtain no plugs in sink or bath but apart from that ok I was considering sleeping in the bath but I put one of my husbands tee shirts on the pillow and made the most of it.Our friends rooms were just as bad I think the cleaner had a problem with her hair as there was the same hairs in everyones beds. Now I can come to the lift do not use even though the stairs are deadly and steep four of us entered the liftto go down stairs and the lift stopped in between floors after ringing buzzer for ten minutes and shouting a handy man came and said he would come back in three minutes fifteen minutes later he came back with some tools and eventualy got us out you have been warned I would not put my dog into this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel ever. period.”
Reviews.Author: charlnorman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room below the stairs with no natural light - bed bugs bit my girlfriend and left her arms and back swollen! (seriously) After a 1 hour fight to get our money back for the nights left over which we booked/paid for in advance (we forfeited the room rate for the 1 night we stayed there - 65 euroes per person!!!) Dodgy wifi, grumpy staff.... if you are a moron - go here.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay was long enough (omg)”
Reviews.Author: 40cat
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel and it was something out of a nightmare. You had to access the hotel through a door in a restaurant then had to go up loads of winding stairs as the lift looked like something from the 1950s. The rooms were clean but the hall ways leading off to rooms were dindgy, dark and dirty. The carpets on the landings looked like they had been down since the 50s too. My personal opinion of the place was it looked like one that were used by cheap prostitues what guys had picked up and took back, it was a really shady seedy looking hotel. Thank god we were only staying for 2 nights, then travelled over to brugge, pheww lol glad to get outta there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it. In a word, Awful !”
Reviews.Author: LeeKent
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel, if you can call it that has is itâ€™s location. Itâ€™s disgusting. The staff are rude and couldnâ€™t care less. Itâ€™s a total rip off for the price. I have stayed in far better hostels than this. The dust in the room is so thick and the bathroom walls were covered in black hairs. The heating didnâ€™t work in the room. The single rooms are so small you canâ€™t even move. There are holes in the walls, curtains and sheets. Itâ€™s a doss house with groups of young drunks shouting and screaming all night. There is no security, just a door left open via an alleyway where people urinate in. Seriously, donâ€™t even consider this an option. I have stayed in some lovely hotels in Amsterdam at a fraction of the cost. This place should be closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Beware overbooking scam!”
Reviews.Author: GerryCLondon
Reviews.Content: Don't be tempted to book here - I had a confirmed reservation via Venere.com but when I turned up (close to midnight as I had advised) they had no room for me. They had cancelled my reservation because they said my credit card had been rejiected, yet I had paid for flights, train and withdrawn cash on the same day they said it was rejected. Instead I suspect they had simply overbooked. After much protest they offered to find me another hotel of similar standard for same price, got a driver to take me to a fleapit a mile away, and then I had little option but to accept a four-bed dormitory that was threadbare and dirty in a decrepit hotel. I would not recommend booking here, and if you do treble check before setting off that they have a room for you - I suspect this was not the first time they had done this!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yrjs2
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much from the Dam Hotel; as we were on a budget I was expecting somewhere basic. But the Dam Hotel was awful. Three of us were sharing a triple room, which was only just big enough for a double. They had crammed an extra bed in and had piled up the remaining furniture in order to leave a small amount of floor space to stand in. This allowed us to notice the grubby old carpet, which - combined with the mouldy shower curtain in the ensuite and the generally unclean state of the place - was more than a little unpleasant. In addition, our room was at the front of the hotel and the Damrak was so noisy at night that it kept us all awake. Positive points were: location close to the station and red light district; bedlinen was clean. I would not recommend this hotel under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: GigCoyle
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a long weekend in Amsterdam last November. I spent ages looking for a decent budget hotel as everything was getting booking up for the Cannabis Cup. I came across the Dam on tripadvisor and although some of the reviews were not great it was cheap so I booked us in. We had absolutely no problems apart from our friends room having a smelly toilet - as we were out 95% of the time it wasn't a huge issue. The combined money exchange/check-in is a bit disconcerting at first but the staff were friendly. The location is excellent and not too noisy at all, we had a 2nd floor room facing onto the Dam. There are steep stairs to climb, if you arrive when the restraunt is closed so you can't get to the lift. The rooms were clean and not too small. Overall I'd say its a great place for a budget weekend in Amsterdam, especially if you plan to experience the night-life.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: she-muff
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here. It is in a central location, yes, but there are many other hotels in the same area that I'm almost positive would be better than this one because this hotel was the absolute worst place I have ever stayed in. I had made reservations through an online booking site in July because the hotel itself does not have its own Web site. We arrived in the middle of the night in September, cold and tired from an international flight (and on our honeymoon!), and the very rude check-in staff informed me he had GIVEN my room AWAY because I was "late." They have a 24 hour check-in desk and I had reservations, yet I was late??? He informed me that "luckily" he had a room to spare, but it turned out to be a tiny single room with a horrible mold smell, for which I still had to pay the price of the double I had earlier reserved. In addition, I paid in cash, to which he said he had no change and would give it to me in the morning. When I asked for a receipt confirming this, he yelled, "DO I LOOK LIKE A THIEF TO YOU???" How rude! I couldn't sleep all night. The next morning, there was another lady staffing the counter who seemed puzzled at first when I asked for my change but eventually gave it to me in an abrupt fashion. We checked out right away and chose to wander the streets with our bags rather than leave it at that shifty hotel. The location is not worth it. Find yourself a better hotel because no one deserves to be treated that way.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Bunnie29
Reviews.Content: This is a small budget hotel situated 5 minutes walk from the Central Rail Station. It's a no frills place which is reflected in the price, the reception is a money changing counter, you book in and are given your card key and directions to your room - there are no luggage porters. I had a single room which consisted of bed, single wardrobe which contained a digital safe, folding chair, and a TV. ensuite shower/toilet/basin. The shower curtain was too short which resulted in a puddle after use. The room was basic but clean the only dust being on the TV screen. Breakfast consisted of fruit juice, ham,cheese, bread roll, croissant with a variety of spreads and coffee - ample to keep you going till lunch time. Being on a main road in the heart of Central Amsterdam you get traffic and people noise into the early hours. The price was right, the location was great and I would certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: shoegal24
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable and in a great location. If you're on a budget and need to be in the centre of Amsterdam then there is no better place. Perfect for young couples, singles and travellers. All in all, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: printerr
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an American style hotel, you will be sorely disappointed. If you are looking for a clean and affordable place to stay, the Dam Hotel is great. I was traveling alone, so had a "single" room. I can't say what larger rooms are like. But my room was comfortable, with two thick cots (smaller than a twin bed, but not flimsey like a typical cot), and a private bathroom with a commode, sink, and shower. All linens were provided. Up until midnight, there is elevator service via the adjoining hotel (even after midnight, I was able to walk up the stairs to the first floor and then take the elevator the rest of the way up, but I can't guarantee that is always possible). My particular room had a great view out over Damrak. Because Damrak is a busy area, there was a considerable amount of street noise, but as the night wore on, the noise level diminished. The street noise was primarily people walking, although there were taxis and trolleys in the area as well. The location of the Dam hotel is perfect. It is approximately 2 blocks south of Central Station. There is an information center outside of the Central Station. Across the street from the hotel, slightly to the right, is the entrance to the red light district. Dam Square is several blocks south. There are many restaurants and tourist shops in the area. I felt perfectly safe walking alone, even at night - although in the red light district I did have to keep my chin up and my eyes focused forward when some men began calling out "Hey baby" and other catcalls. Also, I went to the Anne Frank House, which was easily walkable from the hotel in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Value for money”
Reviews.Author: kordelia
Reviews.Content: We founfd the hotel online and preferred for its location. It gives a great advantage to walk most of the touristic spots in Amsterdam . It is not very cheap, you don't get the best service. Its not flashy but clean enough. Might try another hotel next time, but if you are after a couple of nights in the heart of the city, not a bad option to choose.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam6680
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Dam hotel twice.. and have booked a third time for December.....for me its a bed for the night, not a palace, no frills, just a bed and a shower.....Thats what you get for the money. It is a pain having to check in at the money exchange, the room is small, it has a tv, and a view across to the grasshopper.. if your room is at the front.. the single rooms seem to be on the first floor... looking in that direction. I have never had a problem with the Hotel. the baggage store room is small, but hey... You cant complain for â‚¬ 40 / night. Like i said you get what you pay for.... If you want nice things in your room... dont book this hotel... I am not fussy so if like me you want a bed and on suite toilet and shower ... BOOK it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: SwissMiss123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 3 friends in June 2006. There was no deadbolt lock or security chain on the door, and my friend and I were robbed in the middle of the night. A computer, a wallet, and over 200 Euros cash were stolen. The thief got in because he had a copy of the master keycard and used it to go room to room until he found sleeping people (my friend and I). The hotel refused to accept any finanicial responsiblity, and did not even change the master keycard code. This hotel is both incredibly unsafe and run by unscrupulous management. It is certainly not worth the low price.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fair enough, it's not exactly the Hilton but if you are looking for a cheap, basic hotel that does the job then the Dam Hotel is fine. I admit, the building is a bit grotty, but the room we had was at least clean and had a view of the canal. If you have the cash, then i'd say go up market but if you are looking for a short stay, somewhere cheap and very central then it's really not that bad. After the previous review we were expecting something far worse so maybe read that one first! Plus, breakfast is served until 10:30, which after a night in Amsterdamis quite useful!

HotelInfo.Name: Dam Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Damrak 32, Amsterdam 1012 LK, The Netherlands
